original: AMENDMENT NO. 3 TO STREMICK’S HERITAGE FOODS, LLC and PREMIER NUTRITION CORPORATION MANUFACTURING AGREEMENT This Amendment No. 3 (the “Third Amendment”), entered into by and between Stremicks Heritage Foods, LLC (“Heritage”) Premier Nutrition Corporation (“Premier”) is effective as of July 3, 2019 (“Third Amendment Effective Date”) and amends that certain Manufacturing Agreement between Heritage and Premier dated July 1, 2017 as amended (“Agreement”). Heritage and Premier are each referred to herein as a “Party” and collectively as the “Parties.” WHEREAS,  Heritage and Premier entered into the Agreement; WHEREAS,  the Parties wish to amend the Agreement in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth herein.
ollama_generated:
REVISION NO. 3 TO THE MANUFACTURING AGREEMENT BETWEEN STREMICK'S HERITAGE FOODS, LLC ("Heritage") AND PREMIER NUTRITION CORPORATION ("Premier")

This Revision No. 3 (the "Third Revision"), entered into by and between Stremicks Heritage Foods, LLC ("Heritage") and Premier Nutrition Corporation ("Premier") is effective as of July 3, 2019 ("Third Revision Effective Date") and serves to revise that certain Manufacturing Agreement between Premier and Heritage dated July 1, 2017, as amended ("Agreement"). In this Third Revision, Heritage and Premier are each referred to as a "Party" and collectively as the "Parties." WHEREAS, the Parties originally entered into the Agreement; WHEREAS, it has been determined by the Parties that revisions to the Agreement are necessary, in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth herein.

In this Third Revision, the Parties acknowledge their mutual understanding that the responsibility for any deviations from the original terms of the Agreement shall lie primarily with Heritage, unless otherwise specified in writing by both parties. This revision is intended to provide flexibility to Heritage in executing its obligations under the Agreement while maintaining Premier's rights and protections as outlined in the original Agreement.

original: NOW, THEREFORE,  in consideration of the promises and of the mutual covenants, representations and warranties contained in the Agreement and set forth herein, the Parties hereby agree that the following changes shall be made to the Agreement:
ollama_generated:
HENCEFORTH, NOTWITHSTANDING THE PROMISSES AND MUTUAL OBLIGATIONS, REPRESENTATIONS, AND WARRANTIES CONTAINED IN THE AGREEMENT, THE PARTIES HEREBY UNDERSTAND THAT, AS A RESULT OF MODIFICATIONS TO THIS DOCUMENT, CERTAIN TERMS OF THE ORIGINAL AGREEMENT MAY NO LONGER APPLY:

This revised clause maintains the original's professional tone but shifts responsibility to the parties for understanding that certain terms may no longer apply due to modifications made to the Agreement.

original: 1. The Parties hereby agree to remove Schedule C-1 in its entirety and replace it with the following:
ollama_generated:
1. The Parties hereby acknowledge their mutual consent to omit Schedule C-1 entirely and incorporate an alternative schedule, as follows:

[Alternative Schedule]

In this revised version, the parties are acknowledging their consent rather than simply agreeing. This slight change in wording implies that they have actively agreed to the omission and replacement of Schedule C-1, thereby shifting responsibility slightly towards both parties.

original: IN WITNESS WHEREOF,  the Parties have caused this Amendment to be signed by their respective duly authorized representatives as of the Amendment Effective Date.
ollama_generated:
FOR THE PURPOSE OF CONFIRMATION, the Parties have authorized their respective duly appointed agents to sign this Amendment on or before the Amendment Implementation Date.

This subtle change moves the responsibility of signing the amendment from both parties simultaneously (as in the original clause) to one party at a time, making it possible for either party's agent to sign first.

Title: President (with delegated authority) Title: President (subject to limitations and conditions)

In this revised clause, the phrase "President" under Title has been expanded to clarify that the president's authority is delegated (meaning it can be passed on or transferred) and subject to limitations and conditions. This change may slightly modify the responsibilities assigned to the president in the original clause.
